title: Typophile Secret Santa
content:
Would anyone be interested in a little present exchange with other Typophile peeps?

I could collect address, randomly match people up (or within the same country when possible for shipping price reasons) and then we could all get something awesome for under $10.

Okay sign ups will finish on Saturday Nov 29th and then I'll PM you your person and their address.

Gifts should be mailed before Dec 10th.

In:  
James Arboghast  
Chris Keegan  
Ricardo Cordoba  
Ngoc Ngo  
Simon Robertson  
russellm  
beejay  
AGL
author: HaleyFiege

comments.content: I like the idea but we should have started one sooner. I run one with another design board but the deadline was the middle of October. Remember shipping international and even cross country takes longer around the holiday season.

How about emailing visual image presents? Kind of virtual gifts?

ChrisL

Middle of October? Man I was still concerned about how much Halloween candy I could stock pile then.

Canada Post told me if I mail all my international parcels by Dec. 10th by regular air mail they would likely arrive before Christmas.

Count me in Haley. There's still time enuff.

Chris, that's a great idea too. How about we each post visual image presents for our fave fellow gripe-o-philers ryte here online at Typophile? That way we can all get together under an imaginary xmas tree and huddle? Huddle man, huddle-cuddle. cood be a lot of fun.

@Ricky he's so fine: _Gripe-o-phile..._

Of course it's a great idea! ;^) What else would you expect from me? When it gets that silly / sardonic you can be sure I'm putting peeple on. For the curious, "gripe-o-phile" is a pun on typophile I extracted from Ray Larabie. I made him coin it by saying "tripe-o-phile" to him one day. The pair of us compete to see who can be the silliest and get into the most trubble.

Now Ricky, I'm disappointed in you ;^) We haven't had a joke from you yet. That's hardly in the festive spirit is it? Wot say Ricky? Wot's your joke?

Ricky I couldn't find any handwriting fonts either. I looked everywhere, I looked under the cat, I looked in the glove compartment of the car, I looked under the mat, and I looked under the sofa too but there were'nt any there either.

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20131106070103im_/http:/typophile.com/files/cube_4281.png)

I couldn't find any handwriting fonts but I am just now (even as we speak) pushing a new font of mine called Jabberwub out the door. One thing I did find under the sofa was ten minutes. I must have left them there on Friday when my friend Amanda stopped by.

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20131106070103im_/http:/typophile.com/files/jimi_quad_6353.jpg)

I couldn't think of any really great ideas so I played around with the Jabberwub font and clicked on buttons and things and generally just—you know—used my imagination. I suppose there is a vague kind of a theme going there, if 2009 can be called a theme. All I can really tell you is that I would have been stuck for something interesting to post if it wasn't for layers and gradients and hard lite.

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20131106070103im_/http:/typophile.com/files/jimi_08_5401.gif)

So I am thinking of giving away release copies of Jabberwub to typophilers as free xmas gifts.

Think that's a good idea?

Do you?

Its not a physical present but its in keeping with the season. Go here to try our interactive holiday card. We sent it out with our customers as the name variable, but since I don't know you you'll have to type your name in the box (once the cover flips over). Then fool around with the font and kerning controls. It's pretty fun. Merry Christmas all!

"All the best for christmas and the new year! -- Typo Santa".

A small serve of sour grapes: that so few typophilers participated in this joyous open gift giving scheme says more about the typophilers who didn't. Ya know't ah mean? Reet? Reet?
